entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 9:07AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRST SNOWFALL FOR ANCHORAGE, MATANUSKA VALLEY, SOUTHERN SUSITNA VALLEY THIS EVENING... Afternoon rain today will transition to mixed precipitation by mid-afternoon, transitioning to snow by the early evening. Little to no accumulation is expected at sea-level and light wet accumulation at higher elevations. Specifically, there is potential for up to

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 7:38AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS EXPECTED TODAY FOR THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS AND ALASKA PENINSULA... Gusty west-northwesterly winds are expected along the Eastern Aleutians and Alaska Peninsula as a low moves through the Southern Bering Sea. The strongest gusts are expected from Cold Bay to King Cove later

entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday Through Thursday... ...Snow and Blowing Snow With Low Visibility Tuesday Through Wednesday... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 6:17AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snow Southeast of Delta Junction Tonight... Isolated to scattered snow showers will occur today with little accumulation. Significant snow will develop southeast of Delta Junction tonight and continue through Tuesday morning. Between 1 and 4 inches of snow are possible southeast of Delta Junction, with the heaviest snow from Dry Creek to Tok and south of Donnelly
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 09 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain And River Rises Possible Latter Half Of This Week For SE Alaska... An atmospheric river will move over the Gulf of Alaska and into the panhandle for the latter half of this week. This will bring periods of moderate to heavy rain as the moisture band moves over panhandle.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 10:50AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Lingering high water from Hurricane Ian in late September will keep levels along the Saint Johns river high as water moves downstream through the basin. The forecast point at Astor remains near Record Flood stage and is forecast to rise back up to 4.5 ft by Tuesday,

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 10:46AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Lingering high water from Hurricane Ian in late September will keep levels along the Saint Johns river high as water moves downstream through the basin. The forecast point at Deland remains in Record Flood stage and will continue to rise with a forecast crest near 6.4

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 10:44AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns river to remain high as water moves downstream through the basin. The forecast point at Sanford is forecast to remain near the record crest of 8.9 feet today before beginning a slow decline.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 10:40AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns river to remain high as rainfall drains into the basin. The forecast point above Lake Harney at Geneva is experiencing record flooding. Despite a slow decline, the river level will remain

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 10:35AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Cocoa 9w affecting Brevard County. .Lingering higher water from Hurricane Ian in late September will keep the Saint Johns River near Cocoa in Moderate Flood stage through at least mid week before starting a slow, steady decline by this weekend.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:43AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated danger for field fires Tuesday... An elevated risk for field fires will develop Tuesday with warm weather and dry conditions prevailing. By Tuesday afternoon, south winds will become breezy at 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph greatly increasing the risk for spreading fires as minimum relative humidity levels drop to between 30 and 40 percent.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 10 at 9:33AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... Lane Regional Air Protection Agency has continued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect until 5 PM PDT Wednesday. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 07 at 11:23AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: An Air Quality Alert has been issued by the Washington Department of Ecology in Yakima for Chelan and Douglas counties and remains in effect until further notice. The Washington Department of Ecology has announced an Air Quality Alert for Chelan and Douglas counties, due to risk of wildfire smoke. This Air Quality alert is in effect until further notice.
